page.title: 14STREAMS IN CHILMARK/TEFFONT
page.content: {Chilmark and Teffont}are both built beside{small chalk streams. {Chilmark stream}is a{winterbourne.}It is fed by springs rising at the foot of Kents Hill and all along the valley In the summer it gradually drains away leaving a dry empty bed where docks, grass and nettles will flourish. The stream will not flow again until the storms and rains of November cause the springs to rise. Sometimes water will flow across the road from under stone walls and houses where special drains have been built to prevent flooding. {Teffont stream}flows all the year from Springhead, a patch of common land on the Wylye lane where springs bubble out of the chalk hill with a bushy slope above.The stream runs beside the road, and each cottage has its own little bridge, making Teffont the most beautiful village in S.Wilts. D.L.F.
